intro: Thymus saturejoides subsp. commutatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, aromatic leaves that are typically narrow and linear, giving it a distinct appearance. The plant produces pink to violet flowers in dense clusters during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy ornamental and medicinal plant. Its essential oils contain thymol and other compounds, contributing to its use in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
